topFlavours.name: Crispy tarantulas
topFlavours.description: Bizarrely, they became popular and are now served as a deep-fried snack throughout the country. Apparently they taste a bit like crab.

topFlavours.name: Century egg
topFlavours.description: The eggs (also known as hundred-year eggs or pidan) are covered in clay, ash and salt for months, by which time the yolk is dark green and stinks of sulphur. Mmmm!

topFlavours.name: Stargazey Pie, England
topFlavours.description: A pie with fish that stare at the sky: Stargazey originates from the Cornish village of Mousehole in England, and is served on Tom Bawcockâ€™s Eve (23rd December).
